beakr 0.4.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Allow Cross-Origin-Requests

Source: R/utils-middleware.R
cors.Rd

Allow CORS-headers as described in MDN Web Docs. A minimal example of CORS usage that allows wild-card origin and default methods:

newBeakr() %>%

  cors() %>%

  httpGET(<route_A>, function(req, res, err) {
    ...
  }) %>%

  listen()

cors(
  beakr,
  path = NULL,
  methods = c("GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE", "OPTIONS", "PATCH"),
  origin = "*",
  credentials = NULL,
  headers = NULL,
  maxAge = NULL,
  expose = NULL
)

Arguments

beakr

Beakr instance object.
path

The path to bind CORS to.
methods

The request methods to allow e.g GET, POST.
origin

The allowed origin to enable resource sharing.
credentials

Boolean to enable credentialed requests.
headers

The allowed headers.
maxAge

The max age, in seconds.
expose

The headers to expose.

Value

A Beakr instance with CORS enabled

See also

Request, Response, Error
